newsitem.title: INDIA: India rupee ends up at 35.86 as dlr demand weakens.
newsitem.headline: India rupee ends up at 35.86 as dlr demand weakens.

text.p: The Indian rupee ended up at 35.8625/8675 against the dollar on Monday after touching a day's high of 35.885 as dollar demand weakened, dealers said.
The day saw normal dollar supplies, they said.
A leading Calcutta-based bank was bidding for dollars from morning. "He bought at 35.8850 level and brought it down by half a paise each time to 35.8650," said a dealer.
The forward dollar premia rose from weekend levels on the back on a spurt in overnight call rates, dealers said.
The six-month annualised forward premium closed at 7.36 percent, down from Friday's closing rate of 7.19 percent.
Dealers reported good demand for March delivery dollars.
